intro: Schmidelia panigera, commonly known as the golden sand mat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It has a sprawling growth habit with fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Schmidelia panigera is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, succulent leaves. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in desert ecosystems.
